info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 1:44AM CDT until March 27 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron and Willacy.
* WHEN...Until 345 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Los Fresnos, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Laureles, Arroyo City, Rangerville, Sebastian, Brownsville, Primera, Combes, Rio Hondo City Hall, Rio Hondo Junior High School, Rio Hondo High School, Rio Hondo Elementary School, Lozano, San Benito Veterans Memorial Academy, Treasure Hills Golf Club and Harlingen Soccer Complex. - Ponding of water along frontage roads between San Benito to Harlingen along I 69E and Highway 77. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
